hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In ${\greenD{6}} = \purpleC{54} \div \maroonD{{?}}$, the $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{54}$.

The $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{6}$.

![Tape diagram showing 54 is equal to 6 equal groups of question mark](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9a22d257662b1a32d3e7455e79b81c2842d7482c)

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{?}}$.

Mario can use these multiplication equations:

- $\purpleC{54} = \greenD{6} \times \maroonD{{?}}$
- $\purpleC{54} = \maroonD{{?}} \times \greenD{{6}}$

question.content:
Mario wants to use multiplication to solve $6 = 54 \div {?}$.

**Which two multiplication equations can Mario use?**
